input_text:
Job Title:  Logistics Analyst (Dallas, TX) - Recent Grads Encouraged to Apply!!

Location: Dallas, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Strategy/Planning, Supply Chain

Description:
We are seeking a dynamic Logistics ERP Analyst to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for analyzing our current shipping processes and leading the transition to the new ERP software system (D365) scheduled to launch in early 2025. This role requires strong analytical skills, project management expertise, and the ability to effectively communicate with team members at all levels.
Essentials DutiesAnalyze current shipping, logistics and supply chain processes to identify gaps and differences compared to the new ERP to early manage and solve bottlenecks and identify possible areas for improvement.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather data and insights on shipping operations.Lead the transition to a new ERP software system for the shipping department during the go-live phaseWork closely with IT and to configure the ERP software to meet the needs of the shipping department.Train shipping department staff on the use of the new ERP software system.Provide regular updates to management on the progress of the ERP implementation and shipping process optimization initiatives.Perform assigned tasks in conformance with procedures and instructions established in the Business Management System (BMS) and in compliance with applicable Environmental, Health, and Safety (EHS) regulatory requirements.
What's in it for youHighly Competitive Base PayFREE MEDICAL INSURANCE for our employees or the option of a highly competitive medical plan with minimal monthly employee contributions and zero deductibles.17 Days of paid and sick and vacation time annually (proration applies year one)401K retirement with up to 6% matching programExcellent dental, vision programs, flex spending accounts, employer paid life insurance Free tele-med physician services Various other company employee-centric initiatives; discounted home/auto insurance programs, supplemental life insurance, and more.
QualificationsBachelor's degree in supply chain management, logistics, business administration, or a related field.Supply chain experience is a plus Strong analytical skills with the ability to analyze data and identify trends.Excellent project management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.Experience with ERP software systems, preferably in a shipping or logistics environment, ideally AS400 and/or Dynamics 365.Excellent communication skills with the ability to effectively communicate with team members at all levels of the organization.Strong leadership skills with the ability to motivate and inspire team members.Detail-oriented with a focus on continuous improvement and innovation.The position requires the ability to work with a personal computer in a Windows environment. Use Microsoft Office Suite software including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook and the Internet, if required. Valid driver’s license and a good driving record.Ability to travel up to 20%, at times.

Experience Level (if available): Associate

output_json.title: Logistics Analyst
output_json.summary: Seeking a Logistics ERP Analyst to join the team, responsible for analyzing shipping processes and leading the transition to a new ERP system.
preferred_degrees: Bachelor's degree in supply chain management, logistics, business administration, or a related field
job_responsibilities: Analyze current shipping, logistics, and supply chain processes
Identify gaps and differences compared to the new ERP
Gather data and insights on shipping operations
Lead the transition to a new ERP software system
Provide regular updates on ERP implementation and shipping process optimization
Perform tasks in conformance with BMS and EHS regulatory requirements
benefits: 17 Days of paid and sick and vacation time annually
401K retirement with up to 6% matching program

other.content: Supply chain experience is a plus
